subject: Re: [junit] Strange request: examples of "beautiful" test code
msgSnippet: ... Seriously? You find this: public void testDivideByZero() { try { int n = 2 / 0; fail(); } catch(ArithmeticException ex) { // pass } } easier to read than
messageBody:
On 11/28/06, Michael Feathers <mfeathers@...> wrote:
>
> I think that JUnit3 test code is more beautiful than its competitors and
> successors because it's appropriately minimal. It makes good things easy
> and bad things difficult.


Seriously?

You find this:

public void testDivideByZero() {
try {
int n = 2 / 0;
fail();
}
catch(ArithmeticException ex) {
// pass
}
}


easier to read than this:

@Test(expected=ArithmeticException.class)
public void divideByZero() {
int n = 2 / 0;
}

?

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
